## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 243, 318]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[740, 303, 908, 318]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 880, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 216, 695]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 696, 732, 728]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 819, 92]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) is projected vertically upwards from horizontal ground with speed \(15 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 586, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the speed of \(P\) when it is \(10 \text{m}\) above the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 144, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 445, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
At the same instant that \(P\) is projected, a second particle \(Q\) is dropped from a height of \(18\mathrm{m}\) above the ground in the same vertical line as \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 491, 146, 509]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 491, 693, 509]]<|/det|>
Find the height above the ground at which the two particles collide.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 114]]<|/det|>
A particle moves in a straight line starting from rest from a point \(O\). The acceleration of the particle at time \(t\) s after leaving \(O\) is \(a \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 2}\), where \(a = 4t^{\frac{1}{2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 125, 146, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 123, 487, 144]]<|/det|>
Find the speed of the particle when \(t = 9\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 125, 920, 144]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 460, 186, 477]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 460, 920, 497]]<|/det|>
Find the time after leaving \(O\) at which the speed (in metres per second) and the distance travelled (in metres) are numerically equal.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 476, 920, 495]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
A toy railway locomotive of mass \(0.8\mathrm{kg}\) is towing a truck of mass \(0.4\mathrm{kg}\) on a straight horizontal track at a constant speed of \(2\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) . There is a constant resistance force of magnitude \(0.2\mathrm{N}\) on the locomotive, but no resistance force on the truck. There is a light rigid horizontal coupling connecting the locomotive and the truck.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 152, 146, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 152, 420, 170]]<|/det|>
State the tension in the coupling.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 152, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 262, 146, 281]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 262, 581, 281]]<|/det|>
Find the power produced by the locomotive's engine.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 262, 920, 281]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 406, 702, 425]]<|/det|>
The power produced by the locomotive's engine is now changed to 1.2 W.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 438, 146, 457]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 438, 920, 471]]<|/det|>
Find the magnitude of the tension in the coupling at the instant that the locomotive begins to accelerate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 453, 920, 472]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 821, 92]]<|/det|>
A horizontal force of magnitude \(F \mathrm{N}\) is applied to the block in a direction parallel to \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 148, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 792, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(F\) for which the magnitude of the force in the strut \(AD\) is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 499, 91]]<|/det|>
It is given instead that \(\mu = 0.8\) and \(T = 15\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 522, 123]]<|/det|>
Determine whether \(B\) will move up the plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[225, 87, 809, 191]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 210, 920, 260]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a smooth track which lies in a vertical plane. The section \(AB\) is a quarter circle of radius \(1.8 \text{m}\) with centre \(O\). The section \(BC\) is a horizontal straight line of length \(7.0 \text{m}\) and \(OB\) is perpendicular to \(BC\). The section \(CFE\) is a straight line inclined at an angle of \(\theta^\circ\) above the horizontal.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 272, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.5 \mathrm{kg}\) is released from rest at \(A\). Particle \(P\) collides with a particle \(Q\) of mass \(0.1 \mathrm{kg}\) which is at rest at \(B\). Immediately after the collision, the speed of \(P\) is \(4 \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{-1}\) in the direction \(BC\). You should assume that \(P\) is moving horizontally when it collides with \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 336, 148, 355]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 336, 702, 355]]<|/det|>
Show that the speed of \(Q\) immediately after the collision is \(10 \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 337, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
When \(Q\) reaches \(C\), it collides with a particle \(R\) of mass \(0.4 \mathrm{kg}\) which is at rest at \(C\). The two particles coalesce. The combined particle comes instantaneously to rest at \(F\). You should assume that there is no instantaneous change in speed as the combined particle leaves \(C\), nor when it passes through \(C\) again as it returns down the slope.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 151, 146, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 151, 601, 168]]<|/det|>
Given that the distance \(CF\) is \(0.4 \text{m}\), find the value of \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[328, 902, 670, 921]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Question 7 continues on the next page.]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 737, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the distance from \(B\) at which \(P\) collides with the combined particle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
